content.rendered:
We at Impendi organized contributions to support those in need in Ukraine.

Our team member Sasha is a proud Ukrainian. She was born and raised in the city called Vinnytsya and studied in the capital Kyiv, before coming to US in 2010. I am sure all of you are following the news and are already affected in one way or another by the Russian invasion into my home country.

Thanks to the Impendi Diversity Inclusion & Equity team  for making this happen. Impendi matched individual contributions on every dollar up to $100 each. Impendi made donations to following organizations:

      1. 50% to Sunflower of Peace
      2. 50% to GoFundMe for Bogolvar Retreat / Iana Shchubelka

Details about the proposed organizations:

    1. Sunflower of Peace

Boston-based non-profit organization that is providing medical and humanitarian aid that will be used by the paramedics and doctors in the areas that are affected by the violence in Ukraine. They are acquiring and distributing first-aid backpacks, medicine, medical instruments, and other means of survival that are saving hundreds of lives.

 

  1. Urgent help for Ukrainian refugees – Transcarpathia

Iana Shchubelka (Sasha’s friend) has organized this GoFundMe page to collect money for the hotel she manages (Bogolvar Retreat Resort) in the West of Ukraine where she has set up a shelter to host displaced women and children for free. This is an individual and not an organization, so money will directly go to the hotel for all needs.
